snippet: The company is expected to divide into two entities — one that consists of its PC business and another that is more enterprise-focused, people familiar with the matter said.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard, on verge of sweeping reorganization, is expected to divide into two entities--one that consists of its PC business and another consisting of computer servers, data storage, software and services aimed at businesses; company aims to find a place for itself in a digital world increasingly dominated by mobile technology.

byline.original: By QUENTIN HARDY and DAVID GELLES

lead_paragraph: The company is expected to divide into two entities — one that consists of its PC business and another that is more enterprise-focused, people familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: Hewlett-Packard Is Said to Be Planning a Split of Businesses
headline.print_headline: Hewlett-Packard Is Said to Be Planning a Split of Businesses
